alert.note: Alert for Bexar; Caldwell; Comal; Gonzales; Guadalupe; Hays; Medina; Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued August 04 at 9:11PM CDT until August 05 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with air temperature up to around 105 degrees and heat index values up to around 109 expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Texas. * WHEN...From noon to 9 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Bexar; Caldwell; Comal; Gonzales; Guadalupe; Hays; Medina; Wilson
